snippet: In 1962, three black players, including the flanker Bobby Mitchell, suited up for the Washington Redskins, making it the last professional football team to integrate.
abstract: Washington Redskins recorded a milestone in 1962 of becoming the last professional football team to integrate; flanker Bobby Mitchell, guard John Nisby and fullback Ron Hatcher, all in their first season with Washington, were the three black players on the roster.
lead_paragraph: In 1962, three black players, including the flanker Bobby Mitchell, suited up for the Washington Redskins, making it the last professional football team to integrate.

headline.seo: 50 Years Ago, Redskins Were Last N.F.L. Team to Integrate
headline.main: Fifty Years Ago, Last Outpost of Segregation in N.F.L. Fell
headline.print_headline: Fifty Years Ago, Last Outpost Of Segregation in N.F.L. Fell
